trans-unit.source: Defines an attribute that specifies the scope where a build provider will be applied when a resource is located.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProvider> class will parse and generate code during compilation for a resource with a specific file extension.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProviderAppliesToAttribute> attribute defines the location scope for which the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProvider> object will be called.

By setting the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProviderAppliesToAttribute> attribute, you can limit a <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProvider> object to certain reserved ASP.NET directories, such as \App_Code.

If you do not apply a <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProviderAppliesToAttribute> attribute to a <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProvider> class, the default is <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProviderAppliesTo.All>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.BuildProviderAppliesToAttribute"></xref> class that applies to the specified resource location.
Gets a value that indicates where the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.BuildProvider"></xref> class will be applied when a resource with the appropriate extension is found.

A <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.BuildProviderAppliesTo"></xref> value that indicates where the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.BuildProvider"></xref> class will be applied when a resource with the appropriate extension is found.
